    import {SmoothBurstyRateLimiter} from 'coinme-node/js/RateLimiter.js'
    public class | source

    SmoothBurstyRateLimiter

    Extends:

    js/Ember.js~Ember.Object → CoreObject → RateLimiter → SmoothRateLimiter → SmoothBurstyRateLimiter

    This implements a "bursty" RateLimiter, where storedPermits are translated to zero throttling. The maximum number of permits that can be saved (when the RateLimiter is unused) is defined in terms of time, in this sense: if a RateLimiter is 2qps, and this time is specified as 10 seconds, we can save up to 2 * 10 = 20 permits.

    Returns the earliest time that permits are available (with one caveat).
    public

    reserve(permits: Number): Number

    Reserves the given number of permits from this {@code RateLimiter} for future use, returning the number of microseconds until the reservation can be consumed.
    public

    reserveEarliestAvailable(permits: Number, nowMicros: Number): Number

    Reserves the requested number of permits and returns the time that those permits can be used (with one caveat).
    public

    tryAcquire(permits: Number, timeout: Number, unit: TimeUnit): Promise

    Acquires the given number of permits from this {@code RateLimiter} if it can be obtained without exceeding the specified {@code timeout}, or returns {@code false} immediately (without waiting) if the permits would not have been granted before the timeout expired.
